alert.note: Alert for Graham; Haywood; Jackson; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 8:20AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Graham, Haywood, Jackson, Macon and Swain. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rainfall had generally moved east of the Advisory area this morning. Radar and rain gauges show totals ranging from 1.5 to 3.5 inches over the past 12 hours. Additional scattered showers may cross the area from the west through 9 am, but additional rainfall amounts will be light. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Sylva, Waynesville, Bryson City, Robbinsville, Cherokee, Cullowhee, Lake Junaluska, Maggie Valley, Balsam, Webster, Dillsboro, Town Of Santeetlah, Fontana Lake and the greater Fontana area. High water levels will continue along the Nantahala River near Rainbow Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
